intro: Jaltomata diversa, commonly known as the variable jaltomata, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Jaltomata diversa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or shaded environments.
